content: Find the equivalent Celsius and Fahrenheit temperature for 34.4°C.

The temperature 34.4°C is already given in Celsius, so it remains 34.4°C. To convert this to Fahrenheit, you can use the formula:

\[ \text{Fahrenheit} = (\text{Celsius} \times \frac{9}{5}) + 32 \]

Plugging in the value:

\[ \text{Fahrenheit} = (34.4 \times \frac{9}{5}) + 32 \]
\[ \text{Fahrenheit} = (61.92) + 32 \]
\[ \text{Fahrenheit} = 93.92 \]

So, 34.4°C is equivalent to 93.92°F.
